fr.cyann.react
Class Signal<V>

java.lang.Object
  fr.cyann.react.Signal<V>
Direct Known Subclasses:
AbstractReact, Var
public abstract class Signal<V>
extends java.lang.Object

The Signal class. Define the base class of all discrete and continous react. Creation date: 11 oct. 2013.

Version:
v0.1
Author:
Yann Caron

public void emit(V value)
Command react to emit a signal.
Should be overrided to add automatic behaviours like emit counter time management etc.

smooth

public Signal<V> smooth(long delay)
Emit event after a delay. If another event is emited, delay is postponed.

Parameters:
delay - the delay to wait.
Returns:
the new created signal.

filter

public final Signal<V> filter(Predicate1<V> function)
Filter the event according a criteria.

Parameters:
function - predicate to filter. If result is true, event pass else it is blocked.
Returns:
the new filtered signal.

filterFold

public final Signal<V> filterFold(V initialize,
                                  Predicate2<V,V> filter)
Filter the event according a criteria on the value and it's previous.
Finish signal is not filtered.

Parameters:
initialize - the first value to compare signal value.
filter - predicate to filter. If result is true, event pass else it is blocked.
Returns:
the new filtered signal.

filterFold

public final Signal<V> filterFold(V initEmit,
                                  Predicate2<V,V> fEmit,
                                  V initFinish,
                                  Predicate2<V,V> fFinish)
Filter the event according a criteria on the value and it's previous.

Parameters:
initEmit - the first value to compare signal value.
fEmit - predicate to filter. If result is true, event pass else it is blocked.
initFinish - the first value to compare finish signal value.
fFinish - predicate to filter finish. If result is true, event pass else it is blocked.
Returns:
the new filtered signal.

fold

public Signal<V> fold(Function2<V,V,V> function)
Fold current value with previous one. Finish signal is transformed with the same functor.

Parameters:
function - specify the action to perform between previous value and current.
Returns:
the new value.

fold

public final <W> Var<W> fold(W initEmit,
                             Function2<W,W,V> fEmit,
                             W initFinish,
                             Function2<W,W,V> fFinish)
Fold current value with previous one.

Parameters:
initEmit - the first value to fold for emil folding.
fEmit - specify the action to perform between previous value and current for event.
initFinish - the first value to fold for finish folding.
fFinish - specify the action to perform between previous value and current for finish event.
Returns:
the new value.

then

public final <W> Signal<W> then(Signal<W> then)
Expects the first signal, then the second one before emit resulting. signal.
Difference with sync is that signals should be consecutives.

Type Parameters:
W - The value type of the second signal.
Parameters:
then - The second signal.
Returns:
The resulting signal.

when

public final <W> Signal<V> when(Signal<W> when)
Expects the second signal, then the first one before emit resulting. signal.
Difference with sync is that signals should be consecutives.

Type Parameters:
W - The value type of the second signal.
Parameters:
when - The second signal.
Returns:
The resulting signal.

weak

public final Signal<V> weak()
Break link for dispose mechanism. The weak signal will not be disposed when linked signal is disposed.

Returns:
The weak signal.

until

public final Signal<V> until(Signal until)
Create a long signal. Emit on the beginning and emif finish signal at the end.
Usefull for performing signal loop with start and stop limits.

Parameters:
until - the finish signal.
Returns:
The resulting signal.
